snippet: The attacks signaled a bloody end to a year of rising ethnic, political and sectarian troubles that showed little sign of easing.
abstract: String of attacks in Iraq that leaves at least 3 dozen people dead signals a bloody end to year of rising conflict; insurgents have continued to strike at variety of targets in last two months of 2012, with apparent intent of exploiting sectarian and cultural divides.

byline.original: By YASIR GHAZI and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Yasir Ghazi reported from Baghdad, and Christine Hauser from New York.

lead_paragraph: The attacks signaled a bloody end to a year of rising ethnic, political and sectarian troubles that showed little sign of easing.

headline.seo: Attacks in Iraq Leave at Least 3 Dozen Dead
headline.main: Violence in Iraq Swells at Year’s End, Leaving at Least 3 Dozen Dead
headline.print_headline: Violence in Iraq Swells at Year’s End, Leaving at Least 3 Dozen Dead
